frame.name: Measures
frame.definition: <def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> is measured in some (implicit) <fen>Attribute</fen> by quantifying the <fen>Count</fen> of a particular <fen>Unit</fen> whose value for the <fen>Attribute</fen> is known. LUs and constructions whose meanings inherit from Measures are used in a relatively small, delimitable set of constructions. They may be complements of particular lexical constructions (a <ment>length</ment>of 20 ft., <ment>measures</ment> 20 ft.) or parts of non-lexical constructions (including Transparent Noun constructions and Measurement_plus_adjective and Measurement_plus_PP).</def-root>

FE.name: Count
FE.definition: <def-root>The number of <fen>Unit</fen>s of the measured <fen>Entity</fen> . <ex>The ads had been absorbed into her brain during <fex name="Count">many</fex> <t><fex name="Unit">hours</fex></t> <fex name="Entity">of television watching</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>The known quantity with respect to an <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Entity
FE.definition: <def-root>The item which is quantified in terms of the <fen>Attribute</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Attribute
FE.definition: <def-root>The aspect of the <fen>Entity</fen> which is being described and quantified.</def-root>
